page.title: 15Hemerdon Village.
page.content: The centre of the village is at a road junction. On one corner is Stert Farm. On the opposite corner are some old cottages which used to be miners' cottages. Also at this junction are three bungalows and a drive leading to Hemerdon Farm. There is a bench, telephone box, a tap and a waste bin. We walked down the lane past the cottages. We saw a large house built in 1930 and next to it was a field for grazing and a hay field which was being cut. A little farther on we came to Windwhistle Farm which specialises in rearing pigs. Back in Hemerdon we followed Galva Road passing "The Miners' Arms" which has a children's play area. There are a number of attractive old cottages. There is no shop or school in Hemerdon. The children go to Sparkwell School. Johanna Stidson.
